title: Two persons killed in separate accidents
byline: Two persons were killed and two others injured in separate train accidents yesterday (19).

title: India’s sword-wielding grandmother still going strong at 82
byline: India’s sword-wielding grandmother still going strong at 82An 82-year-old woman who teaches the ancient Indian martial art of Kalaripayattu says she has no plans to retire.

title: Brazilian teacher nabbed at BIA with cocaine worth Rs. 240 Mn
byline: A Brazilian national was arrested by the Narcotics Control Unit at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) early this morning while attempting to smuggle in nearly 5 kilograms of cocaine worth around Rs. 240 million.

title: More devotees expected in Kandy, people advised to avoid today
byline: Police advised people to refrain from arriving in Kandy today to venerate and pay their respects to the Sacred Tooth Relic as more than 100,000 devotees are expected to arrive in Kandy by this morning.

title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department forecast showers or thundershowers at several places in the Central, Sabaragamuwa, Uva and Eastern Provinces and in the Polonnaruwa, Hambantota and Mullaittivu districts during the afternoon or night.

title: Brazilian nabbed with cocaine worth Rs. 243 million
byline: In a major breakthrough in the fight against international drug trafficking, the Sri Lanka Customs today intercepted a cocaine haul valued at Rs. 243 million.

title: Additional trains for exposition of Sacred Tooth Relic
byline: Additional trains have been scheduled in response to the surge in devotees attending the exposition of the Sacred Tooth Relic at the Sri Dalada Maligawa in Kandy, the Railways Department said.

title: Sri Lanka’s World Cup Rugby Dream Comes Alive
byline: Given Sri Lanka’s status as a rugby-playing nation for the last decade or so, not many would have given them a chance to ever be a part of a Rugby World Cup, but their performance on Saturday (19) has given the whole nation a belief that the Tuskers could finally make it to the biggest stage.

title: SLTB not collapsed but deliberately dismantled, politicians, officials responsible: Minister
byline: The Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) has not collapsed, but it has been deliberately dismantled. Politicians and certain officials must be held accountable for this downfall, said Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation Minister Bimal Ratnayake.

title: 24-hour health team deployed for Siri Dalada Vandana
byline: A 24-hour health surveillance team has been appointed to provide coverage for all devotees attending the ’’Siri Dalada Vandana,’’ Kandy Regional Health Services Director Dr. Senaka Thalagala said.

title: Thousands join anti-Trump protests across US
byline: Thousands took to the streets across the US on Saturday to protest over recent actions by President Donald Trump.

title: Pope wishes worshippers Happy Easter after serious illness
byline: Pope Francis has appeared at the Vatican’s St Peter’s Square to wish ’’Happy Easter’’ to thousands of worshippers.

title: Those involved in corrupt politics are now visibly uneasy: PM
byline: Many people involved in corrupt politics are now visibly uneasy, and it has become increasingly clear that nationalism is being used as a last resort by those who have lost political power, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya said.

title: Postal voting dates announced for LG polls
byline: The Election Commission has announced the dates for postal voting for the upcoming Local Government (LG) elections, slated for May 6, 2025.

title: SLTB earns nearly Rs. 1,300 million over past nine days
byline: The Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) has earned nearly Rs. 1,300 million in revenue over the past nine days, and the income is expected to increase further in the coming days, SLTB Manager H. Piyathilaka said.

title: Beware: Heat rising to caution level
byline: The heat felt by the human body is expected to reach the Caution level in 29 districts.

title: Longdon Place to host crucial Trinity– St. Anthony’s encounter
byline: The much-anticipated President’s Trophy pre-quarterfinal Under-20 rugby encounter between Trinity College and St. Anthony’s College has been rescheduled and relocated. Originally slated for 25 April at the Nittawela Rugby Stadium, the encounter will now take place on 26 April at 6 PM under lights at the CR & FC Ground, Longdon Place in Colombo.
